title: Ellen Fullman Plays Her Long String Instrument @TransformerStat for Three Night
content:
Sonic artist Ellen Fullman explores the acoustics of the spaces she performs in with her installation Long String Instrument, often in collaboration with other musicians. And “Long String Instrument” literally describes what she uses to create sound. The 70-foot instrument features dozens of tuned wires 50 feet or longer which she bows with rosin-coated fingers. 
 
Fullman will perform for three evenings at the Transformer Station, her Cleveland area debut. She’ll be joined by cellist Theresa Wong. Tickets are $27.
